elements.title: Protection Status Bar - Guarantee-First Commitment Surface
elements.description: A non-dismissible protection status bar that renders at the top of every commitment-adjacent screen (proposal card, pricing confirmation, lease dashboard). Uses the deepest primary purple as a solid fill with white text to create the highest-contrast visual anchor on the page. Displays payment guarantee amount and property protection coverage. Designed to answer the hard side's gating question ('Am I protected?') within the first 200ms of screen load, before any other content appears. Based on Mahesh asking about financial protection three separate times across a 13-minute call.

elements.title: Agent Trust Handoff Screen - First Platform Visit
elements.description: The personalized handoff screen that appears on the host's first authenticated platform visit. Mirrors the agent call's information structure: agent's personal note, pre-populated property details from the call, guest profile with vetting status, guarantee summary, and a single CTA. Uses warm off-white background with purple accent bar for the agent's quoted note, creating visual continuity from the human conversation to the digital experience. Based on Mahesh's trust being entirely with Bryant, and Cold Start Theory's insight that agent-mediated trust must be encoded into platform artifacts to scale past the tipping point.

elements.title: Management Company Package Export - Gatekeeper Document
elements.description: A one-tap 'Share with Management' flow that generates a professional, application-formatted guest document for the host's management company. Includes the guest's vetted profile, credit check summary, employment verification, stay terms, and Split Lease's guarantee as a co-signer statement. Formatted to resemble a standard rental application so management companies recognize it immediately. Based on Mahesh's management company requiring a guest application (04:25) and his uncertainty about bridging Split Lease information to his management company ('I'll have to figure out' at 09:34). Cold Start Theory identifies this as an enterprise adoption barrier that must be resolved with documentation in the expected format.

elements.title: Ghost Roommate Progressive Disclosure - Evaluation Teaser & Match Preview
elements.description: A two-layer progressive disclosure component for the ghost roommate concept. Layer 1 (evaluation) is a subtle inline teaser showing only the economic upside alongside the guaranteed base rate. Layer 2 (match found) is a full preview card with the proposed weekend guest's profile, a 7-day schedule visualization showing the weekday/weekend split, cleaning handoff protocol, and incremental income -- with clear Accept/Decline actions. Based on Mahesh's dual response: economic interest ('I'm still getting paid whatever first month' at 10:45) and operational anxiety ('comes with little complications' at 08:31). Cold Start Theory's Hitting the Ceiling warns of context collapse when two guests share one property.

elements.title: Lease Health Dashboard - 3-Month Stability Meter
elements.description: A cumulative lease health dashboard showing the host's progress through the 3-month initial lease. Features a 12-segment progress bar with milestone markers at months 1, 2, and 3, three aggregate KPIs (total income received, on-time payment rate, incident count), and weekly pulse summaries. Designed to convert the passive passage of time into visible accumulation of success, supporting the host's renewal decision with concrete evidence. Based on Ariel's 3-month conditional commitment ('if it was something that worked for her' at 03:26) and Cold Start Theory's Slack threshold (2,000 messages = 93% retention).

elements.title: Counterparty Clarity Map - Three-Party Arrangement Summary
elements.description: A visual arrangement summary card that maps the three-party contractual structure (Host, Split Lease, Guest) using a dot-matrix layout. Each responsibility type (Payments, Property Protection, Communication, Disputes) is mapped to its handler with a filled purple dot in the appropriate column. Designed to be parseable in under 5 seconds, answering the question Mahesh struggled with at 11:27 ('the agreement is, is it between which we...') and 12:04 ('is that something that I would work with you or would that with the...'). Replaces paragraphs of legal text with spatial clarity.

elements.title: Adjacent Network Referral Prompt - Post-Stability Threshold
elements.description: A referral prompt that appears below the Lease Performance Summary at the 3-month stability threshold. Leverages the management company approval pathway as a reusable asset: the shareable message includes the management company's prior approval as social proof. Based on Cold Start Theory's domino effect ('each launch makes the next set of adjacent networks easier') and the insight that Mahesh's management company, once approved, creates a pathway for every other host under the same company. The prompt is one-time, dismissible, and evidence-based (references the host's own successful track record).
